Description: Fragment of East Greek pottery plate; slipped,with glaze mis-fired red-brown; grey core. Bands on underside; two maeander friezes on floor.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p.10, pl. 2, 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.510)
